page.title: 10Don and Dearne Landscape.
page.content: The landscape in our area is dominated by two rivers called the{River Don}and the{River Dearne.}The{Don}flows W to E and the{Dearne}flows NW to SE.There is a{magnesian limestone}ridge running N to S, which the{Don}cuts through at {Conisbrough.}The ridge has a steep edge on the western side of the hill and gently slopes on the eastern side. Windhill school is on a hill called Windhill which is between the two rivers,and from our school field we have a view of High Melton and Barnburgh and other villages beyond. Windhill is made of sandstone which is softer than the magnesian limestone and the hill does not have a steep face to it.The landscape has been changed by reclaimed pit tips near the confluence of the two rivers.
